DOC.detailed_description: First Version : Study Protocol Authors : Thomaidou E. , Vretzakis G. , Argiriadou E. , Stamatiou G. , et al . Perioperative administration erythromycin brain protection Study Setting : On-pump , plan cardiac surgery . Randomized , double blind clinical trial two parallel group . Group A : control group . Group B : erythromycin group ( dose 25mg/kg intravenously ) . Purpose : Neurological complication occur open heart surgery frequency 40 % range major neurological deficit ( due stroke ) neurocognitive behavioral disorder . This study aim determine erythromycin , worldwide know antibiotic , protect brain damage give high dos open heart surgery . Hypothesis : The investigator consume high dose erythromycin protect brain pharmacological preconditioning global ischemia perioperative period heart surgery . The aim study : 1 . To determine effect high-dose perioperative erythromycin administration neurological outcome patient undergoing cardiac surgery 2 . To determine relationship neurological monitoring , specifically NIRS , neurological outcome determine erythromycin affect relationship . Preoperative Period Patient Exclusion Criteria : patient > 80 year old , cerebrovascular disease residual deficit , stroke , alcoholism , psychiatric disease . Preoperative patient neurocognitive status assessment clinical psychologist patient : least one day surgery , perform neurocognitive test . Anaesthesia depth monitoring : continuous measurement bispectral index ( BIS ) . Registration : duration CPB cross clamp time , mean arterial pressure , heart rate , temperature ETCO2 .
